title: Which one is better: wireless mouse or wired mouse? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on your personal choice, though my suggestion would be to buy a wireless mouse.  There are several advantages and disadvantages for using wired as well as a wireless mouse. Wired Mouse vs Wireless Mouse: Wired mouse has a limited space to move and the cable restricts your free movement. Wireless mouse has much larger movable area and the area depends on the range of the receiver.For wireless mouse, you need to consider the battery. Since it is running on battery, the charge will get depleted very fast if you do not manually switch off the power button on the mouse. For wired mouse there is no battery required as it draws power direct through USB.Sometimes the signal from the wireless receiver can get intercepted if you have other wireless devices functioning in the vicinity and can delay the screen response time for the mouse pointer. For wired mouse this condition does not happen.For free movement and cable tangle free movement, wireless mouse is more advantageous compared to a wired mouse.If you are using a wireless keyboard, some mouse manufacturers such as Logitech allows users to use multiple devices using one receiver know as unifying receiver. This will allow users to free up USB ports for other devices. Users can connect mouse, keyboard and pen with a singe unifying receiver.https://support.logitech.com/en_us/software/unifying

Before digging deep into the quest, let's start with the pros and cons: Wireless Mouse Pros: 1. no wire hassle 2. Can operate with up to 10 feet 3. Can perform multi connect screen operation easily 4. Ease of handling 5. Comes with battery standby mode Cons: 1. Requires battery cells- but lasts long as wireless mouse comes with standby mode. 2. The price range starts from minimum Rs. 350 Wired Mouse: Pros 1. The price range starts from Rs. 99 2. Can easily be found on messy work table due to its tail 3. No requirement of battery cells Cons: 1. Can not operate from a distance 2. Wire tangles 3. Not much trending nowadays 4. If got unlucky, will have to face cable cuts Next factors, which play a vital role are 1. DPI (dots per inch)- higher DPI means the best smoothness 2. Clicking sound- the high pitch is annoying 3. Compatibility with OS 4. Warranty type- the brand warranty is good over seller warranty After reading till here, you might have got an idea about which type of mouse is your choice.
